basics.name: Bri Wyatt
basics.label: Sr. Principal Software Engineer
basics.summary: Hey! I'm Justin. I'm an engineer and I love what I do. I'm passionate about making great technology products that have a true impact. I'm also passionate about helping others reach their goals, making work fun, and delivering. I also have 4+ years of remote work experience.

work.summary: In this role, I lead remote teams of software engineers with a focus on delivering software-defined infrastructure services.
highlights: Lead design, development, and implementation of a storage provisioning and management platform
Coached and mentored engineers of all skill levels
Lead efforts to standardize and streamline software development practices
Implemented objective interview practices for engineering applicants across our organization
Implemented and lead technical interview panel
Lead major POC efforts regarding software defined infrastructure

work.summary: In this role, my main focus was driving implementation of modern technology practices in a legacy environment.
highlights: Planning, design, and proof of concept for a distributed container platform to support all Walmart distribution centers
Implemented CI/CD systems and processes to facilitate hundreds of users contributing to centralized configuration management of over 50,000 Linux systems
Drove the use of configuration management testing patterns by creating easy to use repository templates that could be distributed across the company
Champion of software defined infrastructure to internal business units
Helped deliver object storage service that was over 2 exabytes in size and supported millions of users
Team won the President's award, which is the highest honor given by EMC
Implemented three US VMWare clouds to support internal EMC IT workloads
Deployment automation including bare-metal provisioning, platform configuration, and shared services (NTP, DNS, Tacacs+, etc..)
Created the initial designs and POC environments for API driven compute, network, and storage services leveraging Openstack, Ceph, and Cisco ASRs
Developed bare-metal provisioning systems to enable real time system deployment or reclamation. The overall process time for deploying a physical server went from 3 months to 18 minutes.
Created a system leveraging SNMP trap handlers to invoke auto-remediation for infrastructure devices
Implemented higher level APIs above infrastructure endpoints to enforce business rules, provide unified identity, and support audit logging
Developed an in-memory Linux distribution that supported dynamic inventory and component auditing of physical servers
Designed and implemented a system for provisioning and configuration of F5 Virtual Edition (Early form of LBaaS)
Created a storage and network mapping solution to support provisioning and impact analysis
Implementation of software tracking platform to help reduce TCO of virtualized software installations
Designed system to discover unused resources in corporate data centers so they could be reclaimed or decommissioned
Created highly optimized SQL procedures to assist with data mining and analytics
Database management of SQL server clusters
System support for faculty, staff, and students
